dt: {bc}skill acquired by experience, study, or observation
{bc}the conscious use of skill and creative imagination especially in the production of aesthetic objects
{bc}the quality or state of being artful {dx_def}see {dxt|artful||2a}{/dx_def}
{bc}decorative or illustrative elements in printed matter

pt: {sc}art{/sc} {sc}skill{/sc} {sc}cunning{/sc} {sc}artifice{/sc} {sc}craft{/sc} mean the faculty of executing well what one has devised. {sc}art{/sc} implies a personal, unanalyzable creative power.

pt.t: the {it}art{/it} of choosing the right word

pt: {sc}cunning{/sc} suggests ingenuity and subtlety in devising, inventing, or executing.
{sc}artifice{/sc} suggests technical skill especially in imitating things in nature.

pt.t: believed realism in film could be achieved only by {it}artifice{/it}

et: Middle English, "craft, principles of a craft or a field of knowledge, one of the seven fields of study comprising the medieval school curriculum, practical knowledge, code of behavior," borrowed from Anglo-French & Latin; Anglo-French, "skill, craft, knowledge, deceit, sorcery," borrowed from Latin {it}art-, ars{/it} "acquired skill, craftsmanship, stratagem, behavior (in plural {it}artēs{/it}), systematic body of knowledge and techniques, profession, artistic achievement," going back to Indo-European {it}*h{inf}2{/inf}r̥-ti-{/it} "act of fitting or joining" (whence also, perhaps from an adverbialized locative, Greek {it}árti{/it} "just now," {it}arti-{/it} "fitting, correct," Armenian {it}ard{/it} "just now," Lithuanian {it}artì{/it} "close by"), nominal derivative from the verbal base {it}*h{inf}2{/inf}er-{/it} "fit, join" {ma}{mat|arm:3|}{/ma}

M. de Vaan ({it}Etymological Dictionary of Latin and the Other Italic Languages,{/it} Brill, 2008) also adduces from {it}*h{inf}2{/inf}r̥-ti-{/it} Old Avestan {it}ārəiti-{/it} "reward" (Young Avestan{it} aṣ̌i{/it}-). Compare, also with zero grade ablaut and {it}-t-{/it} suffixes, Sanskrit {it}ṛtáḥ{/it} "right, true," {it}ṛtúḥ{/it} "fixed time, order, rule." See also {et_link|article:1|article:1}, {et_link|artiodactyl|artiodactyl}.
shortdef: skill acquired by experience, study, or observation

dt: {bc}produced as an artistic effort or for decorative purposes

shortdef: produced as an artistic effort or for decorative purposes

cxs.cxl: archaic present tense second-person singular of

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}eart{/it}; akin to Old Norse {it}est, ert{/it} (thou) art, Old English {it}is{/it} is

dt: {bc}one that is characterized by performing some action, possessing some quality, or being associated with some thing especially conspicuously or excessively

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, of Germanic origin; akin to Old High German {it}-hart{/it} (in personal names such as {it}Gērhart{/it} Gerard), Old English {it}heard{/it} hard
shortdef: one that is characterized by performing some action, possessing some quality, or being associated with some thing especially conspicuously or excessively

dt: {bc}a popular design style of the 1920s and 1930s characterized especially by bold outlines, geometric and zigzag forms, and the use of new materials (such as plastic)

et: French {it}Art Déco{/it}, from {it}Exposition Internationale des Arts Décoratifs et Industriels Modernes{/it}, an exposition of modern decorative and industrial arts held in Paris, France, in 1925
shortdef: a popular design style of the 1920s and 1930s characterized especially by bold outlines, geometric and zigzag forms, and the use of new materials (such as plastic)

dt: {bc}a form or medium of expression recognized as fine art

dt.t: sees dance as both an {it}art form{/it} and an entertainment

dt: {bc}an unconventional form or medium in which impulses regarded as artistic may be expressed

dt.t: describe pinball as a great American {it}art form{/it}

dt: {bc}an undertaking or activity enhanced by a high level of skill or refinement

dt.t: easy conversation—an {it}art form{/it} in peril of being lost to contemporary schedules

shortdef: a form or medium of expression recognized as fine art
an unconventional form or medium in which impulses regarded as artistic may be expressed
an undertaking or activity enhanced by a high level of skill or refinement

dt: {bc}articles of glass designed primarily for decorative purposes

shortdef: articles of glass designed primarily for decorative purposes; especially : novelty glassware

dt: {bc}of or relating to the history of art

shortdef: of or relating to the history of art
